Triangulation Property¶

class TriangulationProperty.TriangulationProperty(points, trianglesIndices=None)[source]¶

TriangulationProperty - Class for holding and analyzing the triangulation data of a given point set

Attributes

NumberOfTriangles Number of triangles
Points Holds the points dataset
Raster Holds raster dataset
Size Return the size of the property
TrianglesIndices Indices of all the triangles

Methods

AreaOfTriangle(index) Calculates the area of a specific triangle defined by its index in the triangles list
AverageEdgeLength() Calculating the average edge length in the triangulation
AverageTriangleArea() Calculating the average area of all triangles
IsPointInTriangle(x, y, triangleIndex) Finding if a given point (x, y) is inside one of the triangles (defined by its index) @return: 1 - if the point is inside the triangle, 0 - if the point lies on one or more of the triangle edges, -1 - the point is outside the triangle
LengthOfAllEdges() Calculating edges’ length in the triangulation
LengthOfEdge(triangleIndex, edgeIndex) Calculating the length of a specific edge of one of the triangles
MedianEdgeLength() Calculating the median edge length in the triangulation
MedianTriangleArea() Calculating the median area of all triangles
TotalArea() Calculates the total area enclosed in the triangulation
TrimEdgesByLength(maxLength) Removing all triangles which have an edge longer than a given threshold
getValues() Get a specific characteristic value of the property
save(filename, **kwargs) Save the property in either json or hdf5.
setValues(*args, **kwargs) Sets the TriagulationProperty attributes :param trianglesIndices: each row representing a triangle, holding the indices
AreaOfTriangle(index)[source]¶

Calculates the area of a specific triangle defined by its index in the triangles list

Parameters: index – The index of the triangle
Returns: The area of the triangle
AverageEdgeLength()[source]¶

Calculating the average edge length in the triangulation

AverageTriangleArea()[source]¶

Calculating the average area of all triangles

Returns: The average area of all the triangles
IsPointInTriangle(x, y, triangleIndex)[source]¶

Finding if a given point (x, y) is inside one of the triangles (defined by its index) @return: 1 - if the point is inside the triangle, 0 - if the point lies on one or more of the triangle edges, -1 - the point is outside the triangle

LengthOfAllEdges()[source]¶

Calculating edges’ length in the triangulation

LengthOfEdge(triangleIndex, edgeIndex)[source]¶

Calculating the length of a specific edge of one of the triangles

Parameters:
  • triangleIndex – The index of a triangle
  • edgeIndex – The index of the edge * 0 - the edge between the first two points of the triangle, * 1 - the edge between the last two points of the triangle, * 2 - the edge between the first point and the last point)
MedianEdgeLength()[source]¶

Calculating the median edge length in the triangulation

MedianTriangleArea()[source]¶

Calculating the median area of all triangles

Returns: The median area of all the triangles
NumberOfTriangles¶

Number of triangles

TotalArea()[source]¶

Calculates the total area enclosed in the triangulation

Returns: The total area of all the triangles in the triangulation
TrianglesIndices¶

Indices of all the triangles

TrimEdgesByLength(maxLength)[source]¶

Removing all triangles which have an edge longer than a given threshold

Returns: Number of triangles removed
setValues(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Sets the TriagulationProperty attributes :param trianglesIndices: each row representing a triangle, holding the indices
